at.mukprojects.mukcast.message

Interface Message

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DisconnectMessage, ImageMessage, NumberMessage, TextMessage

    public interface Message
extends Serializable
    Classes implementing Message interface are intended to have message semantics.
    A message is an object that is sent to a remote machine in order to trigger actions or retrieve data.

    Once a Message is created, it should not be modifiable anymore. Thus it is recommended but not required that Messages are immutable and prevent intentional as well as unintentional modifications of their state. *

    Furthermore, they implement the Serializable allowing implementations to be serialized.

    Author:
    Mathias Markl
